Module it.polimi.ingsw.psp40
Package it.polimi.ingsw.psp40.view.cli

Class Terminal

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.psp40.view.cli.Terminal
public class Terminal
extends java.lang.Object
Class used to manage the appearence of Terminal using mainly ansi codes and stty command
Author:
TiberioG

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void clearAll()
    clear entire screen and delete all lines saved in the scrollback buffer
    static void clearLine()
    clear entire line
    static void clearScreen()
    clear entire screen (and moves cursor to upper left
    private static java.lang.String exec​(java.lang.String[] cmd)
    Execute the specified command and return the output (both stdout and stderr).
    static int[] getAbsoluteCursor()
    This is able to get the coordinates of the current position of cursor I don't delete this cause it took one afternoon to get it working and can be useful in future
    static void hideCursor()
    Method to disable showing the cursor in Terminal
    static void moveAbsoluteCursor​(int row, int col)  
    static void moveRelativeCursor​(int sugiu, int dxsx)
    moves cursor relatively to actual position
    static void noBuffer()
    Disable buffer in terminal calling stty
    static void resize​(int rows, int cols)
    Method to resize the terminal To enable these in XTerm, set the following resource to true: allowWindowOps To enable these in iTerm2, deselect the following: Preferences > Profiles > [profile] > Terminal > Disable session-initiated window resizing
    static void showCursor()
    Method to enable showing the cursor in Terminal
    private static java.lang.String stty​(java.lang.String args)
    Execute the stty command with the specified arguments against the current active terminal.
    static void superClear()  
    static void yesBuffer()
    enables again buffer if needed, calling again stty

    • resize

      public static void resize​(int rows, int cols)
      Method to resize the terminal To enable these in XTerm, set the following resource to true: allowWindowOps To enable these in iTerm2, deselect the following: Preferences > Profiles > [profile] > Terminal > Disable session-initiated window resizing
      Parameters:
      rows -
      cols -

      private static java.lang.String stty​(java.lang.String args) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
